org.eclipse.jst.ws.jaxws.utils.resources
Interface IFileUtils

All Known Implementing Classes:
FileUtils
public interface IFileUtils

Interface that defines common utilies for file manipulation

Author:
Danail Branekov

java.util.List<org.eclipse.ui.IEditorPart> getEditorsByFileLocation(java.lang.String fileLocation)
                                                                    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Retrieves the editors that are currently displaying the file specfied.

Parameters:
fileLocation - Absolute path to the file
Returns:
Current opened editors of the file specified or an empty list if such are not opened
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file does not exist
See Also:
IResource#getLocation().toOSString()

getCompilationUnits

java.util.List<org.eclipse.jdt.core.ICompilationUnit> getCompilationUnits(java.lang.String fileLocation)
                                                                          throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
Retrieve compilation units for the location specified

Parameters:
fileLocation - The absolute path to the file, e.g. C:\\dir1\\dir2\\file.name
Returns:
The compilation units; cannot be null
Throws:
java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file specified cannot be found in the workspace
java.lang.IllegalStateException - when the file specified is not a compilation unit
java.lang.NullPointerException - when fileLocation is null
See Also:
IResource#getLocation()#toOSString()

Retrieves a list of editors that are currently displaying the compilation unit specified.

Parameters:
cu - the compilation unit; must not be null
Returns:
Current editors list or an empty list in case there are not editors displaying the file specified
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - when the cu parameter is null

getFileForLocation

org.eclipse.core.resources.IFile getFileForLocation(org.eclipse.core.runtime.IPath location)
Retrieve a file instance for the location specified. This method is a convenience method equivalent to invoking ResourcesPlugin.getWorkspace().getRoot().getFileForLocation(location)

Parameters:
location - the file location; must be absolute
Returns:
the corresponding file in the workspace, or null if none
See Also:
IWorkspaceRoot.getFileForLocation(IPath)

setCompilationUnitContent

void setCompilationUnitContent(org.eclipse.jdt.core.ICompilationUnit cUnit,
                               java.lang.String content,
                               boolean force,
                               org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                               throws org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaModelException
Sets the content of the compilation unit specified with the content provided. There is no validation of the content

Parameters:
cUnit - the compilation unit. Must not be null. If the compilation unit does not exist, it will be created
content - the content to be set. Must not be null
force - a flag to handle the cases when the contents of the original resource have changed since this working copy was created
monitor - the monitor to report progress to or null if no progress monitoring is required
Throws:
org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaModelException - when there is a problem with setting compilation unit content
See Also:
ICompilationUnit.becomeWorkingCopy(IProgressMonitor), ICompilationUnit.commitWorkingCopy(boolean, IProgressMonitor), ICompilationUnit.discardWorkingCopy()

setCompilationUnitContentAndSaveDirtyEditors

void setCompilationUnitContentAndSaveDirtyEditors(org.eclipse.jdt.core.ICompilationUnit cUnit,
                                                  java.lang.String content,
                                                  boolean force,
                                                  org.eclipse.core.runtime.IProgressMonitor monitor)
                                                  throws org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaModelException
Sets the content of the compilation unit specified with the content provided and saves the dirty editors if any which display the compilation unit. There is no validation of the content

Parameters:
cUnit - the compilation unit. Must not be null. If the compilation unit does not exist, it will be created
content - the content to be set. Must not be null
force - a flag to handle the cases when the contents of the original resource have changed since this working copy was created
monitor - the monitor to report progress to or null if no progress monitoring is required
Throws:
org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaModelException - when there is a problem with setting compilation unit content
See Also:
ICompilationUnit.becomeWorkingCopy(IProgressMonitor), ICompilationUnit.commitWorkingCopy(boolean, IProgressMonitor), ICompilationUnit.discardWorkingCopy(), setCompilationUnitContent(ICompilationUnit, String, boolean, IProgressMonitor), isFileDisplayedInDirtyEditor(String), saveEditor(ICompilationUnit, IProgressMonitor)
